Project Description
Metro Tile is a small jquery extension that can be used to add Windows 8 - like metro tiles to a website.


Very simply, you can create a "tile" as an html element with 2 nested child elements, and call $.metroTile() on the outer element, and voila you have a fun and exciting metro tile!

Additionally, you can add a bunch of tiles inside a container element, and call $metroTileGroup() on the container, and it will create a group and create metroTiles from all the internal tiles. It also adds a cool (IMHO) fly-in transition to the group. I couldn't get this to work in jsfiddle, and I haven't had enough time to figure out why, so to see the group functionality, please download the source, and open the metro.tilegroup.html file.

I created this for a specific site I am working on and thought it might be useful to others, I have more to do to turn it into a true jquery plugin, but the initial stab at it seems to work well.

If anybody has any ideas to improve it, let me know.
